The game has no other aim but to cause as much damage to the ragdoll physics man as possible. The figure can interact with ramps, a truck and a wall.
Players can sit the man in the truck, on the cabin, on the very top, or stand him in front of it. The player sets the speed of the truck and where the ramps are located — if they are to be present at all — and simply lets the carnage unfold. Players are given points dependent on how much damage they inflict on the stick figure."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truck_Dismount Truck Dismount]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

200532.name: Addition and Subtraction
200532.description:
This is one of a series of educational games published early in the 20th Century by Cincinnati Game Co. The 52-card deck is made up of two each of 1, 2, 3, 4, 5; three each 6 and 7; four each 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13; and two each 14, 15, 16, 17, 18 and 19.

The rules booklet describes two group games and a class exercise for Addition; three group games for Subtraction; and a game and additional exercise for Addition and Subtraction.

In the first game, two cards each of 1-9 form a table deck, with three cards laid out and a fourth face up on top of the deck. The rest of the cards are dealt to the players. Each player in turn must try to use two or more of the table cards to equal a card held in hand. The player takes all of the cards in the set, new cards from the deck are turned over to fill any gaps, and play continues until the deck is exhausted. The player collecting the most cards through sets wins.

200533.name: Prospero Station: Discoveries
200533.description:
User summary:

This accessory provides print-and-play components to support the game. Each page contains three "Discovery" cards; ten cards are completed, and two cards are blank (for player improvisation).

Use of the accessory requires the core rules.

200534.name: Prospero Station: Secrets
200534.description:
User summary:

This accessory provides print-and-play components to support the game. Each page contains eight "Secret" cards.

Use of the accessory requires the core rules.

200536.name: The Starfish Ambassador
200536.description:
From the introduction:

The Starfish Ambassador is a comic roleplaying game for 3 or more people. One player will take the role of the assistant to the Starfish Ambassador, which is a game-facilitating role similar to that of a game master in traditional RPGs. The remaining players will each take the roles of Senators from different states in the US, each of whom wants to land the factory and all of the jobs that come with it in their home state. In addition to the players, this game requires a stopwatch, a number of counters equal to the number of Senator players, one pen, and several pieces of paper or note cards.

User summary:

Two versions of the game are available. The initial version was submitted to the Little Game Chef 2010 competition and has no attribution. The second version includes credits. In addition, the authorial comments vary. The game itself is the same.

200537.name: Word Game
200537.description:
Word Game is one of a series of educational card games published at the turn of the 20th Century by Cincinnati Game Co.

The game consists of a deck of 111 half-size cards, each bearing a single letter, with the number of each letter varying from 1 (j, k, q, v, x, y, z) to 12 (e). The rules booklet describes a Primary Exercise for first-year students, three Group Games and four Class Exercises.

In Group Game 2, for instance, one of each vowel is placed face up on the table, and the rest of the vowel cards are distributed randomly to the players and also placed face up. The rest of the cards are distributed face down as equally as possible. Each player draws a hand of five consonants, and then in turn try to form words using cards in hand and vowels on table. Players may also play cards from hand that add to existing words and make new, longer ones. The first player to empty his hand wins.

The rule booklet concludes with rules for using this deck to play Niloe, a word game published separately by Cincinnati predecessor Fireside Game Co. in 1896.

200538.name: Qualia
200538.description:
User summary:

This game is entirely free-form and relies solely on shared narrative creation. The most interesting aspect of the game involves the explicit meta-game relationship between the characters and the "players" (in technical terms, the "players" in the game are also characters); the game refers to this relationship as "immersion".

200539.name: Yacht Sea!
200539.description:
This release includes rules for Yacht Sea!, a maritime-themed game (specifically the scoring sheets and gold "treasure" dice) based on Yahtzee and additional rules for playing Ship, Captain, Crew.

From the publisher (both descriptions):

Yacht Sea!: The object of the game is to collect as many points as possible by rolling certain combinations with five dice. A player may throw the dice up to three time during their turn. After each roll, the player chooses which dice to keep and which to roll again. The player must put a score or a zero into a score box after each turn. The player with the most points at the end is the winner!

Ship, Captain, Crew: Played with five dive, the object is to roll a Six (Ship), a Five (Captain, and a Four (Crew) while trying to get the highest score possible by adding together the sum of your remaining two dice (The Ship's Cargo).

200540.description:
Heist to Paradise - a Dice Game where Crime does Pay! Play the roll of a Criminal and your goal is to rob banks, steal cars, hack computers, and do other mischievous missions to get $1 Million and flee to Paradise! Compete against other players playing as individual criminals or gang together in up to a 9 player game with 3 teams with 3 players on each!

A perfect game for those who love rolling Dice in a fast paced, roller coaster ride of cops and robbers. It's easy to learn and has advanced play features with a timer element adds only more drama! For those who's want to increase the difficulty or just to avoid your slow friend sucking all the fun out of the game taking too long every turn you're now timed on your missions! Besides... who's going to really give you all day to rob a bank anyways?
200540.name: Heist to Paradise

200541.name: Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead
200541.description:
Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead is a roguelike set in a post-apocalyptic world. Surviving is difficult: you have been thrown, ill-equipped, into a landscape now riddled with monstrosities of which flesh eating zombies are neither the strangest nor the deadliest.

Yet with care and a little luck, many things are possible. You may try to eke out an existence in the forests silently executing threats and providing sustenance with your longbow. You can ride into town in a jerry-rigged vehicle, all guns blazing, to settle matters in a fug of smoke from your molotovs. You could take a more measured approach and construct an impregnable fortress, surrounded by traps to protect you from the horrors without. The longer you survive, the more skilled and adapted you will get and the better equipped and armed to deal with the threats you are presented with.

In the course of your ordeal there will be opportunities and temptations to improve or change your very nature. There are tales of survivors fitted with extraordinary cybernetics giving great power and stories too of gravely mutated survivors who, warped by their ingestion of exotic substances or radiation, now more closely resemble insects, birds or fish than their original form.

Source: The Game Website.

200542.name: En5ider (Issue 77 - May 2016)
200542.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this GM advice article, Brandes Stoddard takes a look at the ways a GM can make a gothic horror adventure feel a little more scary. From tragic outcomes to dark secrets, and a new optional rule for Innocence, these tips will help bring your gothic horror sessions to life!

200543.name: Stack Tactics
200543.description:
Stack Tactics is a abstract strategy game for 2 or 4 players where the goal is to capture the other opponents chips. This is done by stacking more chips than your opponent on a square.

Using 4 dice per turn, you execute your strategy by choosing what chips to move, where to move them and how big to make your stacks. 4-player allows unique co-operative attacking.

200544.description:
Your galaxies have expanded to the extent of known space. You overlap with your rivals and fight tooth and nail for fertile planets. Now it is time to extend the horizons. Now it is time to upgrade your ships to the limits of today’s technology, and ready them with the brave pilots. Now it is time to go beyond the deep blackness of space into the truly unknown universe…

In Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond the Black, players have access to four new ships that they can upgrade their original ships to. To do this, they will need to hire specialized pilots. There are many pilots to hire, each possessing a unique special ability. Pilots are also specialized in what ships they are trained to use. Hiring the right pilot for a ship reduces that pilot's cost. The more ships a pilot is specialized in, the weaker their special ability is. Pilots are hired by spending unused dice that correspond with the four different ship types, and are worth victory points during play. Pilots are shuffled into a deck and splayed out like planets.

Additionally, Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond the Black introduces a press-your-luck exploration option for players. This allows players to venture beyond the planets and into deep space where they might encounter dwarf planets worth victory points, or rare materials that yield resources... or they may encounter cosmic threats like solar storms, black holes, and even supernovas. Either way, exploring deep space provides a player with exploration badges. These badges are tallied up at the end of the game and players are rewarded bonus victory points based on who has the most of a certain badge type. They are four types of badges to collect.

Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond the Black also comes with additional planets and new and exciting secret missions to explore!
200544.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond the Black
boardgamepodcastepisode: 18. Devon Dice Podcast - Warring colons
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen
Episode 1 - We're All Stories In The End
Episode 34 : Scythe Review + Interview with Lance "Undead Viking" Myxter
Gen Con Day 1 Recap
HLG 10: Meer Essen
RDTN Episode 101: The Networks, America, Quartz, and the Flying Squirrels

200545.name: Elevator
200545.description:
The idea of Elevator is to get rid of all your cards. All the cards are dealt out at the start. You start with five cards and take cards from your own stack as you play.
Save your wilds for when you need them, try and stop your neighbor from going out by sacrificing and taking the pile, or change the elevator to "going down" if you know your neighbor has high cards.

What is in the game:
A sturdy box with 3 decks of cards, (marked for easy separation when playing with less players).
Instructions for gameplay

200546.name: Kerää kansallispuku!
200546.description:
A simple roll-and-move game about Finnish folk costumes. The goal of the game is to collect a set of five cards from the same folk costume. One card may be replaced with a wild "trader" card.

On their turn, players roll a D6 and move along a board. Depending on the square landed, player may either take a card from the deck, trade cards with another player or take a wild card. The first player to collect a complete five-card set of the same folk costume wins the game.

200547.name: Maurice vs. Niek
200547.description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0020 is 'Maurice vs. Niek', and was published for the 40 year anniversary.

This game is an area enclosure game by Martyn F for 2-4 players. Each player controls 3 committee members on a 12x9 board. Each turn, a player moves one of his committee members in a straight line, and then places two blocking pieces (Ducosim members) on a spot where two of his committee members could move to. A player controls an enclosed area if he has the only committee member there.
The person with the most enclosed squares (most are worth 1, some 11) wins the game when a player can take no more moves.

200548.name: Squer
200548.description:
Introduction

Squer is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The suggested board sizes are between 5x5 and 9x9. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.


Definitions

To flip a stone means to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, whenever possible, you must perform exactly one of the following actions:

- Maneuver: If you're Black, place one black stone on an empty point and flip all lines of horizontally adjacent white stones that are horizontally adjacent to your placement. Conversely, as White, place one white stone on an empty point and flip all lines of vertically adjacent black stones that are vertically adjacent to the placement.

- Sweep: If you're Black, flip a line of horizontally adjacent white stones whose ends are horizontally adjacent to white-colored board edges. Conversely, as White, flip a line of vertically adjacent black stones whose ends are vertically adjacent to black-colored board edges.

If you have no moves available on your turn, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.


Objective

After a pass or a maneuver, the player who made it loses if there's a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of the opponent's color touching the two opposite board edges of that color.

After a sweep, the player who made it wins if there's a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of their color touching the two opposite board edges of their color.

Draws are not possible.

200549.name: Royal Defense
200549.description:
“Royal Defense” is an easy fantasy-themed strategy game. You are supposed to assume the role of the militant feudal and to put a halt to the hostile lords’ encroachments on the throne of the fairy kingdom. Mercenaries will help you: they are ready to spill their blood on the battlefield for a pretty penny and promises of glory.

“Royal Defense” vaguely resembles “Battles of magicians” and “Memoir’44”. Lords’ castles are located on both sides of the game-board. Players can recruit troops and build fortifications there. The battlefield itself is two-sided and it contains special structures, giving bonuses to players who occupy these locations.

Before starting the game, each player chooses one of the four mercenary factions, which will be his army. Characters of each faction are represented by the cards. They have their own particularities, strengths and weaknesses. A lot of soldiers have not only ordinary characteristics such as velocity, attack and defence, but also some special abilities (which are very often unique for the army) that can be used during the game.

The confrontation between barons is very swift. Having recruited troops from hand, a player can move forward and attack. As soldiers can move only forward, so five “corridors” appear on the battlefield where the major battles occur. But each player can activate only five units during his or her turn, and some characters can change the lines they move along. All these points transform simple mechanics into an interesting tactical puzzle. The more the player is experienced, the more difficult is to solve this puzzle. Moreover, spells, able to change course of action, are available for each player. Soldiers also can be sent to the Catacombs in the hope of finding treasures hidden there.

There are two ways to win: to help your mercenaries to end up beyond the edge of your adversary’s field or to get 20 points for having struck adversary’s troops and having destroyed his structures.

“Royal Defense” is a duel strategy game with low learning curve. Its rules are easy to explain and the game will not take long. Besides, rules also propose different options for three and four players.

200550.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Tomo dei Morti Volume II
200550.description:
From the back of the book:
Queste pagine raccolgono segreti e testimonianze sui più terribili orrori partoriti dal Giorno del Giudizio: i Morti.

English translation:
These pages collect intelligence and evidence on the most terrible horrors born from the Day of Judgment: the Dead.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
200551.description:
A pencil and paper game of building railway networks for one or more players.

30 Rails is played on a 6 x 6 grid of squares. First, each player draws mountains, a mine and four stations on their sheet. The game then consists of thirty turns which will fill the remainder of the grid with track. Each turn two dice are rolled. One die will determine which track type is placed, the other gives constraints as to where the track can be placed. The winner is the player who can connect most stations to each other, and to the mine.

The advanced game adds shares. Players are required to buy shares in any particular line in order to score for it, but choosing the right moment to do so gives flexibility to track placement.

Designed for the 2016 One Page PNP Contest
200551.name: 30 Rails
boardgamepodcastepisode: #43: Coldwater Crown review; Sagrada on tap; Holmes: Sherlock & Mycroft
1P 104 - Mow Money

200552.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XXI
200552.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XXI, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 21 mythic spells, from telekinetic sphere to undeath to death. A mythic teleport can take you to specific places on other planets or planes, although with decreased accuracy. Mythic temporal stasis can be set to end automatically, and can be made to allow the target to take purely mental actions, while mythic touch of idiocy not only drains mental ability scores, but can also render the target amnesic or mute, or force them to act a fool, and mythic tree shape allows you to take the form of a fruit tree, oak tree, or willow tree, each with specific benefits. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

200553.name: OGL Redheads
200553.description:
From publisher blurb:

MUTANTS OR MAGICAL?!

They are front-and-center in just about any sci-fi and fantasy genre item you care to mention... they are the Redheads! And now, for the very first time, you can bring that emphasis to your d20 System games with feats, talents, and a template designed by Steve "Ravenloft" Miller and L.L. "Feats of an Adult Nature" Hundal!

OGL Redheads is compatible with other NUELOW releases in the Modern Advances and Modern Basics series, and usable with all major d20 System game lines (and most minor ones, too).

200554.name: Summoner
200554.description:
From publisher blurb:

The summoner is a sub-class of magic-user that gains his magical powers by making a pact with an outsider, a being from the outer planes. This pact is one of mutual benefit, as both the summoner and the outsider, known as an eidolon, gain in power.

This eidolon physically manifests on the material plane with the summoner. Its physical shape is determined when it is first summoned. It will perform tasks for the summoner, including fighting as well as casting spells.

Although primarily intended for first advanced edition, it also contains tables for other popular versions: original edition, basic and expert edition, and the cyclopedia edition.

200555.name: Fool of the Feast
200555.description:
The King is holding a great banquet and demands the kingdom’s best entertainment possible. Therefore he has invited all Troubadours and Fools around to audition their best show. The winner will become Fool of the Feast and well rewarded.

Fool of the Feast is a light pocket card game for 2 - 4 players where you try to put on the best show for the King. Only three cards are played in a game round, but with split cards and special actions there is a more complex strategy to explore.

The second time a players show gets the king’s favour - that player wins. A show consist of three rounds. Each round a card is played. First the entertainer presentation, then a fist act and lastly a second act. During the game the King reveal what he likes to see - and players now have to use the different card actions to make their show fit the Kings wishes.

The show with the most points total wins the king’s favor that round. The crown icons on a card is basic points you will score for act. So more crowns means a better act. This will be modified by what themes the king like and don't like. So if the king laughs at your rivals "juggling monk" - you might need to mess that show up.

The goal is to become the king’s fool - so basically everyone wins.

This game was originally a submission for the 18 card contest 2015. It was one the 18 finalists.

200556.name: Sonderaktion Rot
200556.description:
From the crowdfunding campaign:

El segundo suplemento, Sonderaktion Rot (Acción Especial Roja), con más de 120 páginas, se ocupa de la colonización de Marte por las potencias enfrentadas en Walküre. Este suplemento es hermano de Mondblinheit, el primer complemento para el juego, tratando en detalle la colonización de la Luna, que fuera impreso y publicado por nuestros medios.

Como hiciera Mondblindheit con la Luna, Sonderaktion Rot incluye información a raudales sobre el planeta rojo y las bases de las diferentes potencias. Además incorpora una cronología extensa y específica que recoge los acontecimientos más relevantes que atañen al complejo proceso de colonización de Marte. Como decíamos, las bases aparecen bien descritas, con sus mapas de ubicación, personajes relevantes, fuerzas militares desplegadas, incluyendo tramas de aventura.
Por si fuera poco, incorporamos un listado de armas nuevas y equipo completo inédito, así como reglas para netrunning e informática avanzada. Además incluye un buen listado de fotografías históricas e ilustraciones, algunas de las cuales pueden ver bajo estas líneas.

200557.name: Kreuzfeuer
200557.description:
From the crowdfunding campaign:

Kreuzfeuer (Fuego Cruzado) es un suplemento detallado y compendioso que aporta mucha información adicional centrada en la época crítica de la Guerra Fría, desde el término de la Segunda Guerra Mundial hasta finales de los años 80. En este suplemento, entre otras cosas, se detallan por primera vez en Walküre las funciones de la Abwehr, el servicio de inteligencia de la Wehrmacht alemana, contrapartida del GRU soviético.
Pero hay mucho más en Kreuzfeuer, como por ejemplo: operaciones secretas de todas las agencias de inteligencia (incluyendo la que da nombre al suplemento, Kreuzfeuer, un operativo ultra-secreto de los servicios de inteligencia nazis para acabar con la vida de Kennedy), agentes operativos relevantes, personajes políticos, equipo novedoso de espionaje, una cronología detallada y ampliada de estos años, información sobre técnicas de espionaje, armamento de la época (en especial armas de mano como revólveres y pistolas automáticas), mapas y mucho más. Este suplemento está escrito, maquetado e ilustrado, ocupando más de 100 páginas a todo color, con fotografías de época e ilustraciones originales, listo para ser enviado a imprenta inmediatamente después de que la campaña obtenga el dinero suficiente para costear su impresión. Además se han añadido al mismo 10 ilustraciones inéditas licenciadas, algunas de las cuales pueden ver bajo estas líneas.

200558.name: Pinball Wizard (1987)
200558.description:
User Summary

Pinball simulator for 1-4 players. The game speed can be adjusted before the game starts.

Coder: Hans Georg Berg
Graphics: Gabi Kittner

200559.name: Game of Thrones: Intrigue at King's Landing
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
200559.description:
Game of Thones: Intrigue at King's Landing is a print & play card game for 3-4 players based on the hit TV series Game of Thrones, where each player represents one of the great houses of Westeros struggling for dominance and to ultimately claim the Iron Throne.

Each round, each player chooses one scheme that they are trying to fulfil. Players then make deals, conspire and back-stab to either support or oppose these schemes. Helping another player with their scheme may be easier, though if they are successful that player will gain a powerful ability that may be used against you later in the game! Players must also be careful of opening up support of their schemes to the wrong house, as a well-timed betrayal can leave you losing everything to an adversary.

Schemes also award armies, gold and power to those who are most successful in carrying them out or preventing them from coming to fruition, all of which contribute towards the award of four prestigious titles as well as your claim to be ruler of Westeros!

200560.description:
These promos add two new historical exhibit cards and one more Midway Ticket card for even more fun World's Fair history and game play.

The set of 3 promo cards for World's Fair 1893 contains:
Electric Kitchen
Bavarian Sleigh
Wild West Show
200560.name: World's Fair 1893: Promo Cards

200561.name: Shmadow
200561.description:
User Summary

Shadowy images + Shoot'em ups = Shmadow. Using directional buttons and a separate control to aim your shots, this twin-stick shooting game features you as a ball of light casting an aura on the obstacles and enemies that oppose you. Each time you are hit, your orb of light gets smaller.

200562.name: Progress
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
200562.description:
Interact with your iPhone or iPad in ways that you never thought possible! Get ready to be puzzled and amazed as you prod, shake, and dance your way through 100 playful puzzles!

Source: The Game Website.

200563.name: Sage Solitaire
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
200563.description:
Sage Solitaire is a brand new Solitaire variant that combines the luck and joy of Solitaire with the depth of Poker; lovingly crafted, and optimized for your phone.

Source: The Game Website.

200564.name: Sentree
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
200564.description:
Have you ever wondered which of your friends could protect you with their eyes closed? Find out in Sentree - a cooperative, physical mobile game for 2 or more players about helping each other survive through the night in a dark, unfriendly forest.

Source: The Game Website.

200566.name: Vignettes
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
200566.description:
A toyish surprise-o-rama without text nor characters, where an object shapeshifts as the player spins it around, revealing the underlying story.

The different objects and their relations create a virtual map, a web in which the player can move around, sole structure of the game. These objects are put in the forefront as both visual elements and narrative devices - they hold the theme and meaning of the game. The symbolism of each item, as well as its place in the sequence of objects, sets the mood and topic: it creates, step by step, conceptual spaces for the player to navigate.

Source: The Game Website.

200567.name: Ape Out
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
200567.description:
You are a gorilla. Smash your way out of captivity, using your captors as weapons and shields, crushing everyone and everything in your way. Fight for survival with only an innate, unthinking drive towards freedom.

Source: The Game Website.

200568.name: ENOUGH
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
200568.description:
User Summary

Enough is a story of a small creature named Mani trying to find her way in the world. Mani wakes up in an unknown location, and explores the world around her, page by page.

200569.name: Chambara
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200569.description:
Chambara is a stealth-deathmatch game with only two colors, allowing players to seamlessly camouflage themselves with the environment. This empowers players to sneak, search, and ambush each other in dramatic, stylish duels.

Source: The Game Website.

200570.name: orchids to dusk
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200570.description:
Orchids to Dusk is a short contemplative wandering experience by Pol Clarissou with music by Marskye. You are an astronaut stranded on an alien planet, with only a few minutes left to live.

Source: The Game Website.

200571.name: Pitfall Planet
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200571.description:
In a faraway galaxy, two robot astronauts have crash-landed on a mysterious planet. They embark on a mission to scavenge enough ore to fuel their trip home. Their adventure brings them deep into the caverns below, solving puzzles and collecting ore using their trusty grappling hooks. However, ore isn't the only thing that is hidden underground.

Source: The Game Website.

200572.name: Anarcute
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200572.description:
Take control of a crowd of rioters, each one being cuter than the other. Fight the evil forces that took control over the great capitals all over the world and restore peace.

Source: The Game Website.

200573.name: BADBLOOD
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200573.description:
A DEADLY GAME OF HIDE & SEEK.

Source: The Game Website.

200574.name: Beglitched
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Winner
200574.description:
Beglitched is a game about insecurity, in our computers and ourselves. In a pastel world of networks where nobody truly knows what they’re doing, hacking is a magical art and the notorious Glitch Witch is the most premium archmagi of the net. By random circumstance, YOU are her new apprentice. You must use your wits and cunning to unravel the mechanisms of an alien computer and survive amongst a veritable web of clowns, leftclickers, and filedraggers.

Source: The Game Website.

200575.name: Gathering Sky
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200575.description:
Guide a flock of birds through a world where earth, sky, and stars are woven together.
The sky is not a place to conquer, but a place to discover and play.

Source: The Game Website.

200576.name: Not Everything is Flammable
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200576.description:
User Summary

You play as fire incarnate and aim to cause as much property damage as firely possible.

200577.name: Far
videogamehonor: 2016 Gamescom Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200577.description:
Your most amazing journey so far...

Under cloud filled skies, the player travels across the seemingly endless dried-up sea, littered with the remains of a once vibrant seafaring civilization. The game’s world is largely devoid of life, yet filled with places to explore and history to discover.

While the greater goal of the journey remains to be uncovered by the player, urgent short-term necessities call for immediate action. The train-like vehicle used to travel the plains needs to be fueled, maintained and upgraded to master the challenges that lie ahead…

Source: The Game Website.

200578.name: Sumer
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Student Showcase Nominee
200578.description:
User Summary

Sumer is a unique blend of modern board game design and exciting real-time action, set against the beautiful backdrop of a mysterious ancient civilization.

200579.name: Eldritch Express
200579.description:
This game is an express dice game adaptation of Eldritch Horror similar to the Arkham Express dice game. It borrows ideas from Eldritch Horror, Arkham Horror, Arkham Express and Elder Sign. The goal is to make a short and small game that could fit into a small fantasy flight expansion box.

As all lovecratian games, the goal is to prevent an ancient one from awakening by moving around the world to close gates and solve mysteries. You use the “dice express” mechanics to perform your actions and encounter hazards. You will gather clue, items, spells and artifact to make your quest easier and give you a chance to fight monsters. The combat system is deterministic, so you know for sure if you are going to die or become insane. So you might consider an injury or a madness instead, it's hard to live with it, but at least you remain alive.

200580.name: NEXUS
200580.description:
From the Introduction of the book:

En el año 2100, el planeta Tierra se encontraba al borde del colapso. A pesar de los esfuerzos del gobierno global denominado el Dominio, el caos amenazaba con apoderarse del mundo. Los problemas de superpoblación, la sobreexplotación de los recursos naturales y las guerras entre naciones habían situado a la humanidad a las puertas del desastre. Hasta que se descubrió el marzio. Gracias a las aplicaciones de este mineral, y de sus materiales derivados, la civilización humana comenzó a desarrollarse a gran velocidad, llegando a un nuevo período de bienestar. Casi un siglo después las reservas de marzio eran escasas, por lo que se hizo necesario pensar en nuevas formas de obtenerlo...
Cuando se juega a Nexus se da vida a soldados al servicio del Dominio que realizan una misión OEM (Operación de Extracción de Marzio), o a militares que operan para los Rebeldes (grupo opositor al regimen o Dominio), en un entorno Sci-Fi fuera de la tierra.

English translation:

In year 2100 planet Earth was on the verge of collapse. Despite the efforts of the Domain, the global government regime, chaos threatened to take over the world. Overpopulation, overexploitation of natural resources, and international wars had driven humanity to the brink of total catastrophe. Then, marzio was discovered. A versatile mineral with many different uses and derived materials. Thanks to it, human civilization started a fast developing cycle, reaching a new era of abundance. However, before a hundred years passed marzio reserves threatened to run out, and it became necessary to find new sources for the precious mineral.
In NEXUS, you play the role of a soldier serving the Domain, taking part in MEOs (Marzio Extracting Operations), or working for the Rebels (oppositors of the Domain regime), in a Sci-Fi environment outside planet Earth.

200581.name: Science Kombat
200581.description:
User Summary

Science Kombat is a game of the same vein as Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter, except that the characters are famous scientists from different eras. Each character has regular attacks and a couple combos that are thematically matched to their field of study and discovery.

200582.name: Dice City: Game Store
200582.description:
Dice City: Game Store is a promo card for Dice City with the following power:

Roll a Die:
1: Get 1 star
2-5: Get 2 stars
6: Get 3 stars

200583.name: Kimenmura e Youkoso!
200583.description:
User summary
奇面村へようこそ! (Kimenmura e Youkoso!) means "Welcome to the funny face village!" in English. Artwork in the game comes from public doamin works.

A player give a question by expressing two randomly determined feelings in one facial expression. The other players answer the combination of feelings simultaneously. They gain one point if correct. The questioner gains one point if at least one player was correct. Play several times and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
毎回１人が出題者になります。それ以外の人は回答者になります。出題者はランダムで決定された２つの気持ちを１回の表情で表現してください。回答者はそれを見て、どの気持ちの組合せか一斉に回答します。組合せに正解した人と、正解者が１人でもいれば出題者にも点数が入ります。誰かが７点に到達するか、４ラウンド過ぎるとゲームが終了し、最も点数の高い人が勝者として奇面村に取材に行きます。

200584.name: Ambrosia: Basisspel
200584.description:
From the back of the book: Ambrosia is a unique fantasy role-playing game, inspired by the history and folklore of the lowlands (Belgium and the Netherlands). With its streamined but versatile and open ruleset that is just as accessible for newbies as for veteran role-players, and a living, interactive setting, Ambrosia tries to breathe new life into the world of role-playing in Dutch.
This book contains the core rules for Ambrosia, which makes it an indispensable handbook for all players and gamemasters. On its pages, you can find everything you need to create a character; its personality, skills and equipment. The secrets of magic are also revealed.
The base game is the perfect starting point to take your first steps in the mysterious, dangerous, but most of all fascinating world of Ambrosia!

200585.name: Ambrosia: Spelleider-Bundel
200585.description:
From the back of the book: this package contains several useful instruments for every gamemaster! Along with the Ambrosia Base Game, you need nothing more to start exploring the Alverlands. This package contains the following things:
- A deluxe gamemaster screen, behind which the gamemaster keeps the plotlines hidden from prying eyes. The hard cardboard screen shows atmospheric artwork on the front and useful tables on the back!
- "Devil's Winter", a 160 pages long scenario that introduces new players to the game mechanics and setting of Ambrosia, as well as colourful hand-outs for the players.
- A number of blank character sheets.
- Reference cards for the players, containting information on how to take the most commonly used actions.

200586.name: Yoidore Medusa
200586.description:
User summary
酔いどれメデューサ (Yoidore Medusa) means "Drunken Medusa" in English. Artwork in the game comes from public domain works.

In the game of Drunken Medusa, players are assigned a role card as a Medusa or a Medusa Hunter, but they may not look at their own role card; only other players can see it.

You hold your card in front of your forehead so that everyone except yourself can see your identity, and look down the table. Then the game begins. You may look at any other players' role card, but once you happened to see a Medusa card, you must leave the game with a dying scream.

The game ends in 20 or 30 seconds, depending on the number of players. At the end of the game, surviving players may discuss, then vote a player who they think to be a Medusa. The Medusa Hunters win if the most voted player is a Medusa, otherwise the Medusas win.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーにはメデューサカードまたは、メデューサを退治しにきたハンターカードのどちらかが1枚配られます。しかし自分のカードを見ることは出来ません。ゲーム中、自分のカードを他の人に向けて遊びます（インディアンポーカー形式）。ゲームはリアルタイムで進行し、他の人のカードを自由に見ることが出来ますが、メデューサカードを視認してしまうと石化してそのプレイヤーは即座に脱落します。30秒のプレイ時間後、全員カードを伏せて、生き残ったプレイヤーの一斉投票を行います。最多票を集めた人が処刑されます。処刑された人がメデューサであればハンター達の勝利、逆にハンターが処刑されればメデューサ達の勝利です。

200587.description:
Due to a telecommunication snafu, all of the pizza places in town are receiving the same orders from the same customers! The first delivery person to the house gets the tip, but did you remember the order correctly? Which pizza did the zoo order? Mushrooms? Pepperoni?!? You have to race your opponents to get customer’s tips first, but make sure you complete the order accurately or you get nothing!

In Pizza Pronto, 3-5 players compete to deliver pizzas to locations around the table by flicking discs and tossing tokens. Each round, an order is read aloud. “Hello! I need a pineapple and pepperoni pizza at the zoo and a mushroom and pineapple pizza to the firehouse, please.” Players flick their delivery disc in real time, racing to each location. Once there, you can pick up a pizza and try to toss it into the fenced area. When a player has delivered both pizzas, they place their disc in the highest spot on the garage board. Players score points for delivering the correct pizzas to the correct locations, with bonus points awarded for speed and throwing accuracy. Once the deck of cards runs out, the player with the most points wins!
200587.name: Pizza Pronto

200588.name: Colours of Magic: Aqua Teeter
200588.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game based around the mixing of alchemical potions via the medium of moving colours around a tilt-able board.

200589.name: Polyball
200589.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




POLYBALL follows the tale of a low-fidelity ball on a journey through time and space, life and death, from the plains of our familiar world to the depths of the afterlife.

Combining the simple mechanics of classics like Super Monkey Ball and Marble Madness with the visual styling of low-poly artwork, Polyball is a blend of fast-paced time trials and puzzle platforming. Over the course of the game you travel through different environments, from the inside of a volcano to the depths of space, through an abstract world of light and geometry, all the while striving for the best possible time and score. There are a total of 60 levels, divided up into 6 sectors of 10 levels each.

Source: The Developer Website.

200590.name: Legacy: Echoes of the Fall
200590.description:
From Publisher Info

Echoes of the Fall expands Legacy: Life Among the Ruins, giving players and GMs extra options to use in the game. In this book you will find:
- Three new playbooks: The Cultivators of New Flesh use esoteric techniques to grow crops, craft drugs and rear beasts fit for the new world, the Enclave of Sworn Hunters track down the powerful monsters created by the fall, and the Firebrand uses insurrection and sabotage to undermine their family's enemies.
- Salvaged Technology: 10 pieces of pre-Fall tech ready to drop into your game, along with a new system for unlocking the potential of the tech you find in play.
- A Dangerous Wasteland: 20 different locations, settlements, natural hazards, monsters and other threats to fill your game with.

200591.name: Wyrmsun
200591.description:
User Summary

In the Wyrmsun universe a myriad of inhabited planets exist. Humans dwell on Earth, while dwarves inhabit Nidavellir and elves nourish the world of Alfheim. These peoples struggle to carve a place for themselves with their tools of stone, bronze and iron. And perhaps one day they will meet one another, beyond the stars...

200593.name: Quest Stories
200593.description:
From the publisher:
The bartender was giving the spit ‘n’ shine treatment to some old mugs while gazing skeptically at the group of adventurers in front of him, who were practising a somewhat ineffectual heroic pose. There was a magic school dropout trying to pass as a wizard, a deranged oracle claiming a 33% chance of guessing the future correctly, a beastmaster accompanied by the odor of all his beasts, a claustrophobic minotaur and a venomant addicted to his own potions. He sighed. Are these wrecks able to rescue the prince? Probably not, but is there anyone else willing to take the job?

Quest Stories is a narrative game for 3-5 players set in a humorous fantasy world. Each round, one player assumes the role of the bartender, who is looking for the best heroes to accomplish a quest. The rest of the players are hero recruiters who will try to convince the bartender that their hired team is the most suitable to get that job done, while they try to highlight the shortcomings of their contenders.

From the publisher (translated):
El tabernero limpiaba cuidadosamente las jarras de cerveza mientras miraba con escepticismo al grupo de aventureros que, con pose heroica, se presentaba ante él: un hechicero que había sido expulsado de la escuela de magia, una oráculo que decía conocer el futuro con un 33% de probabilidades de acertar, una domadora de bestias que apestaba, un minotauro con claustrofobia y un alquimista adicto a sus propias pociones. Suspiró. ¿Estos despojos conseguirán rescatar al príncipe? Seguramente no, pero, ¿acaso hay alguien mejor en esta ciudad?

Quest Stories es un juego narrativo para 3-5 jugadores y de media hora de duración en la que un jugador, en cada ronda, encarna a un tabernero en busca de los aventureros más adecuados para cumplir su misión, mientras que el resto de jugadores representan a reclutadores que creen tener el grupo de aventureros más adecuado.

200594.name: The Full Moon Murders
200594.description:
A Non-Linear Mystery Adventure

From the introduction:

This document does not give you a step-by-step way to run the module; it gives the DM basic tools to run a sandbox-style adventure. It gives a problem for the player characters to solve.

It also provides non-player characters, their backgrounds and
motivations, and ideas about how to handle certain encounters and situations that may come up in an adventure, but for the most part it does not assume that the players will follow any particular course of action.

User summary:

For four to six 1st - 3rd level characters

200595.name: Quite, Indubitably
200595.description:
From the introduction:

Quite, Indubitably is a friendly and somewhat hybridized role-playing game of imaginative dexterity and excessive competitive verbosity – that is to say, a game where you will need to be able to out-talk your fellow players, while being able to bring into play a variety of vocabulary that don’t enter usage much anymore. Think of it as a strange mix between The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen, Munchkin, and Apples to Apples.

User summary:

The game requires a standard pack of French playing cards, sets of custom cards (provided as print-and-play components in the document), and a large number of d4.

200596.name: Sugorokumaru Ninpoutyou TATAMIJIGOKU
200596.description:
User summary
双六丸忍法帖 畳地獄 (Sugorokumaru Ninpoutyou TATAMIJIGOKU) means "NINJA girl in TATAMI INFERNO" in English.

Sugorokumaru Ninpoutyou TATAMIJIGOKU is roll-and-move style board game for two players.

There are 18 cards placed on the table, forming a triangle. Each of these squares represents a tatami, Japanese flooring material made of woven straw, and has two sides: black and white. Players take turns rolling a die and moving their Ninja pawns along the triangle. If the white pawn lands on a black square that is forming a line of three or more black squares, the white player takes damage, and vice versa. The longer the line of cards, the more damage that player takes.

Before a player rolls a die, that player may play one card from their hand to flip a square specified in the card, and may spend one tatami power to play an additional card.

Each player has a Ninja character who can use their special abilities spending tatami power.

The game ends when a player's life is reduced to zero, in which case the survivor wins, or when any player goes around the triangle three times, in which case the player with the most tatami power remaining wins the game.

Publisher's summary
カードをマス目に見立てた二人用対戦双六。
畳の色を連鎖させて呪いで相手のニンジャを殺す。

200597.name: Rat Race
200597.description:
User summary:

This unusual game has four player roles; one player is the "Liaison" for the entire game; the other players shift roles. In some respects the "Liaison" acts much like a traditional game master, but in other respects this is not the case. The game uses several custom cards (provided as print-and-play components in the rules) and involves the human "Liaison" acting as an intermediary between an alien overlord and human workers. The intermediary faces numerous ethical problems while trying to balance personal risk against the greater good.

200598.name: Last Earth
200598.description:
User summary
In the game Last Earth, the planet Earth has been ruled by gorillas, and the humans preserve their positions as gorillas' slaves.

One day, dolphin-like aliens invade the Earth. The Humans have to choose their way. Do they continue to be slaves of gorillas, or welcome dolphins as new rulers? Which would you do?

Publisher's summary
ゴリラに支配された世界。人類は奴隷として生き延びていた。
ある日の事、そんな地球へイルカの姿をした宇宙人が攻めてきた。
人類はゴリラの奴隷として生きる道を選ぶのか、それとも
新たな支配者としてイルカを選ぶのか、
あなたならどちらにつく？

200599.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 20 - Emerald)
200599.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: A place in the far future, one that is both wonderful and dangerous.

200600.name: Evening Session Map Set #14
200600.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need an encounter map on the fly?

Have Your players turned left instead right (again!)?

Do You want to run a quick game for your friends in the evening and looking for inspiration?

If you answered yes for one (or more) of these questions, The Forge Studios has released a product that suits your needs.

Evening Session Map provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Evening Session Map #14' consists of maps and handouts of a alchemists tower.

The set consists of:

a tower surrodings map
a perspective drawing of a tower ;
detailed interior drawings ( 3 levels);

200601.name: Akeldama Gazini
200601.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nemesis NPCs – Akeldama Gazini is a neutral evil female human with sorcerer levels utilizing the ghoul bloodline. She specializes in both necromancy and enchantment allowing her great influence over both the living and dead. She is an expert at skillful and magical manipulation.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a fearsome foe at all levels, 1 thru 20! This allows you to easily introduce an enemy into your campaign and reintroduce the same enemy at any time with no prior preparation. Simply find the appropriate challenge rating and go. The NPC advances along with your players with no work on your part.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Nemesis NPCs series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new nemesis today!

200602.name: In The Company of Treants
200602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get your Groot on, and grow your Treebeard!

You know you’ve always wanted to play a treant, crushing pesky orcs underfoot and casting down wizard’s towers. Now you can, with Rite Publishing’s In the Company of Treants.

Begin as a young near-sapling and grow your treant as you gain in power until you are one of the true giants of the deep woods. This 40-page supplement, written by Jonathan McAnulty, includes all the options you need for an entire treant-centric campaign, including…

An in-character discussion of who the treants are and what motivates them
3 All-new treant races to better customize your treant character
Alternate racial traits and alternate favored class options
12 extensive racial archetypes which allow the treants to grow in size and take advantage of their unique racial abilities. These include:
The primal forest guardian (barbarian treant) whose rage infuses the trees around him
The verdant healer (cleric treant) whose touch and draughts bring healing
The tree master (druid treant) who commands the trees and understands their thoughts
The woodland tactician (fighter treant) who possesses a great ability to use the forest terrain to his advantage in a fight
The earthborn treant (kineticist treant) who, though he cannot command trees, can command the elements
The serene forest master (monk treant) whose understanding of the trees around him is at once both physical and metaphysical
The prophet of the glade (oracle treant) who can divine portents in the wind and the shadows cast by the leaves. Included are two new mysteries (weather and deep woods) and three treant specific oracle curses (stunted, hollow and fire scarred).
The woodland stalker (ranger treant) who hunts the woods, aided by both plant and animal allies
The wald walker (rogue treant) who much prefers to hit his opponents from a safe distance with an unseen rock
The forest singer (skald treant) whose songs inspire his treant allies and can cause the very trees to move
The scion of the woods (sorcerer treant) whose connection to the land manifests in arcane powers. Included are two separate treant specific bloodlines (ley-lines and fey woods).
The verdant scholar (wizard treant) whose long studies and pursuit of knowledge have made him a formidable foe. He is aided by his bonded tree and access to 8 different treant specific discoveries.
The racial paragon class: the tree shepherd. His focus is on his flocks, and they obey his every command, rising up to fight when he calls them.
The NPC treant class, the weald warrior, for GMs who want to quickly create treant opponents for their adventures
Rules for treant aging and guidelines for their height and weight
5 new pieces of equipment suitable for treants
29 new treant-related feats, including three new combat styles for your treant monks
Rules for talking living plants into acting as traps for you
12 treant magical items and 2 treant artifacts





So come take a walk on the wild side, in the deep forests of the world, and adventure as a Treant.

200603.name: Farlands
200603.description:
User Summary

You play as a research cadet tasked with exploring an alien planet and documenting its plant and animal life

200604.name: Hustler
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (Top Ten re-release) edition
English/European Commodore 64 Cassette (Top Ten re-release) edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Top Ten re-release) edition
200604.description:
From the inlay:

Fancy your chances as a Pool-hall Hustler? Unscrew your cue, get your joystick out and see if you've got the eye for the angles, the deft touch that gives just the right amount of power and spin, the skill that enables you to pot the ball and set up your next shot!
HUSTLER is the realistic pro Pool simulator with...

Keyboard or Joystick control!
Six types of game including two player options!
Control of angle of shot!
Control of strength of shot!
Control of direction and strength of spin!




User Summary

This is a top-down pool game. The six games include the two colour (or spots and stripes) pool played in the UK, but also a number of variants. These include potting any ball in any pocket, potting specific balls in specific pockets, pocketing ball in numeric order and others.

200605.name: Texas Nexus
200605.description:
Too many sheriffs have arrived in Rhymetown and there's only one way to find out who rhymes the best in the wild wild west.

Turn over a card and take it in turns saying words that rhyme with the one on the card. Can't think of a word? Play a sheriff card to put somebody else in the hot seat.

If you don't have a sheriff card left to play and can't think of a word, you're out. The last player standing becomes the sheriff of Rhymetown!

200606.description: Simple roll-and-move race board game played on a map of Australia. Players race from Melbourne to Darwin, with various penalties, bonuses and detours along the route. Line illustrations of animals, birds and Aboriginal artifacts within the map are keyed to a list of their names in the top left corner.
200606.name: Race round Australia

200607.name: Ascot: A Day at the Races
200607.description:
This is a complex horseracing game that includes the purchase, sale and training of individual horses, choosing the best horses and jockeys for each race, establishing betting odds for each horse and trying to win money both by having a horse finish well and by winning bets.

Players each start with GBP250,000 and one horse, all with the same form rating. While at the Auction Ring each turn, a player rolls a D6 three times, to determine the mix of actions he may take: 1=Sell a horse for Form rating times current Auction Price; 2/3=Buy top horse on the deck on the same basis; 4=Read the Ascot Bulletin (draw event card); 5=Change the horse up for auction; 6=Change the Auction Price by drawing a new Auction card.

Then the players take the next card in the Race deck to see the distance, entry fee and prize money. Some races are restricted to horses of a certain Form Rating, or apply handicaps that help low-rated horses. Each player chooses a horse for the race and hires a jockey (better ones cost more). The combination of horse Form and jockey results in a number of tokens for each player. These tokens allow a horse to be moved extra spaces during the race.

The Form ratings of the horses are totaled and each horse uses it rating against the pack to establish betting odds. Players then place their bets and the race begins. Each move is based on an 8-sided die. Horses can move forward or diagonally, but not into a space with another horse. Tokens add one space, but only one can be used per die roll.

After the race, the prize money is paid out, bets are settled, and the game moves to the next Auction phase. The game may be ended after any number of races, with the player holding the most money combined with horse value (10,000xForm) being declared the winning trainer.

200608.description:
A simple roll-and-move race game along a 30-space track circumscribing a map of Australia. Starting from any space, players roll a die and move that many spaces clockwise around the track. Each space contains a hand-painted image of a location on the map in the centre of the board. When a player lands on a space, another player identifies the location, "googles the location on a smart phone" and asks the moving player three questions about that location. If all three questions are answered correctly, the moving player gets to remain at the new location, otherwise he returns to his previous space.
The first player to return to his starting space wins.
200608.name: Australia puzzle map

200609.name: Storyteller Cards: Fantasy
200609.description:
Storyteller Cards: Fantasy are a playing card deck, designed to inspire creativity in gamers, role-players, writers, artists, teachers, parents and children. They were designed by Jason Tagmire and illustrated by Campbell Whyte.

Each card features an illustration with 4 unique elements. There is a character, holding an item, completing an action, in a location. Each of these elements can be used to create something new, get you out of a mid-project slump, or just to have some creative fun with family and friends.

The cards also feature additional icons in the corners to help you dig a little deeper into storytelling, creating, and gaming. The icons represent a rank, suit, mood, season, letter, and color.

The Manual includes rules for different ways to play. From strategic coloring to push-your-luck storytelling, there are game variations for everyone. Many variants are story based gaining points for each card played, best poker hands and matching card elements, but others include strategic coloring (where players must complete illustration quadrants to earn points), and endless possibilities (where the players create and change the rules in a race to 30 points).

The Manual for the Regular deck of Storyteller Cards can be used with Storyteller Cards: Fantasy, and vice-versa.

200610.name: Million Dollars But... The Game
200610.description:
Million Dollars, But… The Game (MDB) is a game that puts your morals and imagination to the test, posing the question, "What would you do for a million dollars?" Players create scenarios by combining a Trigger and a Rule card to showcase what they would or wouldn’t do for a big hunk of cash. (For example, A Million Dollars, But… Every time you see a store having a sale, you poop your pants a little bit.)

The best part of the game occurs when everyone debates the scenarios that have been presented to the judge. “Does it include online store sales or just in-person sales?” “How much poop are we talking: a rabbit pellet or an uncomfortable amount?”

200611.name: Threes
200611.description:
User summary:

The game requires exactly four players. One player assumes the role of "Interrogator" (essentially, the game master). The other three players assume the role of "Suspects". One of the Suspects is guilty of some heinous crime. The game will determine which Suspect is guilty through narrative development.

200612.name: Recall Notice
200612.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game for 2 or more players. One player acts as Bishop, essentially a traditional RPG Game Master who frames scenes, plays the roles of non-player characters and narrates the outcomes of player character actions. The remaining players create and take the roles of Clergy, sent on a mission to the holy Überworld.

User summary:

This game was developed under the working title "Recall Order". The author intended play to be a satirical experience.

200613.name: The Visitor (2010)
200613.description:
From the introduction:

In a nutshell: "Alf" meets "Sign in Stranger" when an eight-foot-tall incomprehensible alien starfish comes to live with a normal human family to try and understand our species.

User summary:

One player assumes the role of an inscrutable alien being. The remaining players assume the roles of a human family. Game setup involves consulting a few random tables to establish the setting and aspects of character roles. Play then follows predominantly a shared narrative development.

200614.name: The Ghost
200614.description:
From the introduction:

Old hatreds die hard, but sometimes it is necessary to set aside petty, personal disagreements for the greater good. The hag, Jeny Greenteeth, is wise and may prove instrumental in the troubles that lay ahead. Your task will not be easy, however; the dark forces of Barovia have agents everywhere, and eyes from beyond the grave no doubt watch your every move. Part Six of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Four-Hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters

200615.name: The Innocent
200615.description:
From the introduction:

The mists have led you deep into Glumpen Swamp to a den of great evil. Within, the unliving son of an unliving god awaits the peace of death that eternally eludes him. Will you grant him his rest, or realize the part he is to play in things to come?
Part Seven of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Four-Hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters

200616.name: The Broken One
200616.description:
From the introduction:

The village of Orașnou is buried in winter's snows and facing starvation. An unseen beast has ravaged the livestock culled to pay Lord Strahd's tax and the village is thrown into panic and chaos. Can you find the monster and save the village from starvation, or worse? Part eight of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A two-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters

200617.name: Nimble Words
200617.description:
Crossword dice game. 13 cubes with one letter on each face, except one blank face on one cube, with a plastic cup. Letters have values similar to Scrabble.

The box says "No. 143" Kohner probably released this at the same time as their Tumble Words (which has dice in three colors, without values, and has "No. 142" on the box). The company address has no ZIP code, so it's probably from the early 1960s if not older.

200618.name: Guest's Treasure Chest Biscuit Game
boardgamepublisher: T. B. Guest & Co. PTY. LTD.
200618.description:
A snakes-and-ladders like game, using palm trees as snakes and packets of Guest's biscuits as ladders, to promote the products of the publisher's Melbourne-based biscuit factory. A metal spinner is built into the board. Counters were provided at the side of the board ready to be cut out, and were differentiated by colour and the name of one of Guest's biscuit products.
The back of the board featured a pirate galleon to be coloured in with paints or crayons.
A player spinning a 6 got a second spin (presumably adding the results together). It was necessary to land on the final square on an exact spin; otherwise the player moved backwards a number of spaces equal to the number spun.

200619.name: The Sea Worshippers
200619.description:
User summary:

The game uses a distinctive character sheet that allows for numerous traits to be recorded. Traits can be either written or drawn. Play involves narrative development followed by voting to distribute, essentially, demerits. After a predetermined length of play a final process is used to determine which character is sacrificed (e.g., which player loses).

200620.name: Verkade's Melbourne-race spel
200620.description:
Simple roll-and-move race game themed for the 1934 MacRobertson International Air Race from from Mildenhall, England, to Essendon airport in Melbourne, Australia. The race was sponsored by confectionary magnate Sir MacPherson Robertson as part of the Melbourne Centenary celebrations. This game published as a promotion for Dutch biscuit company Verkade, is based on the heroic efforts of the Dutch team, flying a KLM Royal Dutch Airlines DC-2, who came second in the race overall but won the handicap prize.
The board is a map of the eastern hemisphere from England to Australia, with 63 numbered circles (unusually, they are not contiguous nor connected by lines) marking cities both on and off (Peking, Algiers) the official race route. 12 of the circles are blue, and have penalties or bonuses described in the lower left of the board.
The game is described as for "een onbeperkt aantal personnen worden deelgenomen" (an unlimited number of participants), and players much pay an ante of five collector cards from packets of Verkade biscuits. Some of the penalty spaces require payment of more cards into the pool. Although not specified, presumably the winner takes the pool of cards.

200621.name: Jeu de la Marine
200621.description:
French 19th century roll-and-move board game, similar to the Game of Goose, with 63 numbered spaces spiraling into the centre of the board. Players roll 2 dice and move that total number of spaces. Bonuses and penalties are incurred on some spaces, as detailed by text in the middle of the board. The theme of the game is a naval expedition. Spaces represent various French admirals, sea battles, and other naval and nautical themes.
Landing one one of three lighthouse spaces (every 9th space) gives you a double move (i.e. if you land on a lighthouse with a move of 5, move on another 5).

200622.name: Le Maraudeur (Issue 19 - May 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Appel de Cthulhu v7 - Malleus Monstrorum
Appel de Cthulhu V7 – Codex de l’Innommable
Elro les bons Tuyaux : Revenir dans le sentier battu
Entretien avec Tristan Lhomme : Des montagnes (de pages) hallucinantes
Faites entrer l’accusé – L’assassinat de Sam Giancana
In Nomine Satanis Magna Veritas Génération perdue
Retour historique sur l'Appel de Cthulhu
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (5th Edition)
Wulin: Chroniques du Pinceau & de l'Epée
200622.description:
Le Maraudeur
Issue 19
May 2016

(Translated) from the cover


Reviews: Degenesis, CoC 7th edition, Dragon de Poche 2, INS/MV, Krystal, Planète Hurlante, P.U.N.C.H. Unit, Rushmore, Wulin...
Interview: Tristan Lhomme
Inspiration: Bring in the accused / Cinema killed me / News...
Universe: Elro / INS/MV / Millevaux...
Scénarios: Shaan Renaissance / Millevaux / Vampire

200623.name: Catch that bunyip
200623.description:
From Box: Alexander the pink bunyip is hungry again. He decides to visit his four favorite shops. But the Bunyip Catchers have other ideas and set out to catch The Bunyip before he returns to the safety of the billabong. Watch Out Bunyip - don't get caught!
[note: a Bunyip is a mythical Australian Aboriginal creature].

Object of the game: The winner is the player who finally catches The Bunyip OR the Bunyip who has visited all four shops and returns safely to the billabong.

One player is the Bunyip, the others are Bunyip Catchers. If 6 play, the 6th is a second Bunyip. The Bunyip(s) starts in the Billabong in the centre of the board, the catchers in the corners of the board. Each player spins a spinner (mounted in the box) and moves that many spaces (1-2-2-3-3-4-5-6).
The Bunyip(s) must pass over (they don't have to stop on) each of the 4 shops in the centre edges of the board. The shops and the pink spaces either side of the shops are prohibited to the catchers. The catchers attempt to land on the Bunyip when he is not in a safe area. If they do so, they spin the Bunyip Escape spinner (a second spinner mounted inside the box): either the Bunyip is moved automatically to another named space, or he is caught (and the catcher wins). If the Bunyip visits all 4 shops and returns to his starting space (the Billabong) he wins. Catchers landing on another catcher send the latter is sent back to his starting space.

The same game system, with different artwork and creatures was used in "Watch out wombat" and the New Zealand version "Catch that kiwi" both issued the following year.

200624.description:
"A game based on the story by Leslie Rees" - box cover.

Published between 1945 and 1954, and based on the best-selling Australian children's book "Digit Dick on the Barrier Reef" by Leslie Rees (1905-2000) illustrated by Walter Cunningham, published by John Sands, Melbourne, in 1942. Set in Queensland, the book details the adventures of Digit Dick , a "little boy only as big as his mother's big toe", who smuggles himself on holiday with his parents in his father's coat pocket.

The game is a simple roll-and-move race game using marbles as pawns on a board mounted in the game box. The track is a connected sequence of 45 holes. Most holes are small enough to hold the marble in place, but 9 of the holes are large enough to swallow the marble (and represent the adventures Dick has in the book).

Players must throw 1 or 6 on a six-sided die to being, then get to roll again for a proper move. If the player's marble lands on a big hole, it rolls down the box and he must start again. If he lands on an already-occupied small hole, he places hi own marble one space behind (which might be a big hole). He must throw an exact number to finish, otherwise he moves backwards the excess amount.

A second version "for older children and grown-ups". In this version, a big hole causes you marble to move backwards 5 spaces (instead of starting again). If the countback takes you past the start space, you must start again.

The rules sheet summarizes the story of Digit Dick on the back, and advertises two other Digit Dick book titles; Digit Dick and the Tasmanian Devil (set in Tasmania), and Digit Dick in Black Swanland (set in Western Australia).
200624.name: Digit Dick's walkabout on the Barrier Reef

200625.name: Beyond the Morning Mountains: Volume One
200625.description:
From the Introduction:

Beyond the Morning Mountains is a solo fantasy adventure gamebook – part story, part game. Reading the numbered sections as indicated by your selections, and by using dice to resolve battles and ultimately determine your fate, YOU will be the
central character in this grand adventure!

Volume 1 in the Tales of Quahnarraen series.

Beginning your journey from central Quahnarren, you will travel over the spectacular and imposing Morning Mountains down to the south-eastern town of Liust, where you will commence a new working life. There are many paths to take across this remarkable land and along the way you will encounter a wide variety of friendly and helpful people, unwelcoming and hostile opponents, and fearsomely wild creatures. Your long adventure will present many challenges and difficulties, testing your decision-making skills, personal abilities, experience and health. It is up to YOU to decide which routes to take, which dangers to risk and which battles to fight.

The included Character Record details all of your personal statistics, clothing, equipment and knowledge gained, and the provided Battle Boxes will record the outcome of hostile encounters using a new and unique gameplay mechanic, known
as the Momentum Sequence, to register the changing fortunes of each combatant.

Do YOU have the ability to survive the long and perilous journey to Liust?

Contains 1000 paragraphs, copious illustrations, descriptions of creatures and maps.

200626.name: Wizard's Tower Solitaire
200626.description: Wizard's Tower Solitaire is a Tarot card game based on the playing card solitaire game Spider. The game begins by laying out all 78 cards face up in 13 rows of 6. Cards of the bottom column are exposed and may be placed below any card of the next higher numerical value or overlapping the next higher numerical value of the same suit. Overlapping cards may be moved as a unit and removed from play when it is complete. Trump cards may be placed under any other Trumps of a higher numerical value or overlapping a Trump of the next higher numerical value. When the Fool is exposed it is transferred to the top of the tableau to form the foundation of the Wizard's Tower and other Trumps are placed on it in ascending numerical value. Any exposed card may be transferred to an empty column and weaving may be used to overcome a blocked game. The goal of the game is to remove all but the Wizard's Tower of Trump cards which remains mysteriously suspended in the air after the cliffs below it have been blasted away by magic.

200627.name: Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower – Mighty Heroes
200627.description:
From the publisher:
The tales and legends of the Silver Tower are numerous indeed; each recalling a different band of unlikely allies, champions finding themselves banding together in the lair of a Gaunt Summoner of Tzeentch. Some seek the glory of a boon from the Gaunt Summoner, others wish to learn his true name and thus strike him down – all must navigate the sheer horror of the Silver Tower.

Only the greatest champions of both good and evil can hope to succeed. These four heroes have found themselves subject to the Gaunt Summoner’s ever-shifting domain:


a Tzeentch Sorcerer Lord, devious and powerful spell-caster;
a Khorne Bloodbound Slaughterpriest, brutal, murderous demagogue;
a Stormcast Eternals Knight-Venator*, glorious sky-archer of Order;
and a Fyreslayers Auric Runemaster, high priest of the forge-temple.


This box set contains four plastic Citadel miniatures, with rules for use in games of Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower. Includes one Citadel 25mm Round base, one Citadel 32mm Round base, one Citadel 40mm Round base and one Citadel 50mm Round base.

200628.name: Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower – Lord of Plagues
200628.description: An additional promo player character, the datacard for which was published in White Dwarf 121 (21 May 2016). Does not come with represetational miniature.

200629.description:
An expansion pack of 40 new building cards, and 2 new Reputation cards.

Metropolis cards have an orange sunset background. When you play with this expansion, you set up an extra row of cards above the normal building cards. Only three cards are available to purchase, and they require you to have one, two, or three books (depending on where they are in the row). You also must have one normal building for every Metropolis building you own. Because they're a little harder to get, each Metropolis card is worth +1 renown.
200629.name: Islebound: Metropolis Expansion

boardgamecompilation: The Resistance: Rogue Agent and Sergeant Modules
200630.description: The Resistance: The Plot Thickens includes the Plot Cards module from the second edition of The Resistance, plus the Rogue, and Sergeant modules originally released as promos. It also includes a full set of replacement Character and Mission cards and new Mission tracking tokens.
200630.name: The Resistance: The Plot Thickens

200631.name: Camp Pokemon
200631.description:
Fun on the Run!
Play fun Pokémon activities to learn the basics about Pokémon, including identifying Pokémon and understanding type matchups.

An Island Adventure!
Explore an amazing island where future Trainers can discover many aspects of the Pokémon universe.

Posing with Pokémon!
Add stickers and frames to all of your photos and turn them into beautiful Pokémon-themed works of art

Collect Cool Rewards!
Complete activities to earn all kinds of Pokémon collectible pins.

Take a trip to Camp Pokémon today!

Source: The Game Website.

200632.name: Qango
200632.description:
Qango is an abstract 2 player game that plays quickly and is explained even faster.

Players place their discs on a square multicolored board and try to either get 3 of their discs in one group of the same color, 4 discs in a square shape, or 5 discs in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row to immediately win the game.
They place one disc at a time and except and aren't limited in how to place the disc after the first move.

The game includes 2 boards, a beginner board with 6x6 squares and an advanced board with 7x7 squares.

200634.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – For Family Honor
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
200634.description:
Description from the publisher:

The War of Five Kings has already begun to shape the future of Westeros. Robb Stark marches on Lannister holdings, even as Tywin Lannister menaces the Riverlands from Harrenhal. To the south, Stannis Baratheon lays siege to Storm's End and Renly Baratheon calls upon the might of Highgarden to break his brother's armies. Yet in the midst of these kingly conflicts, another drama unfolds far to the north. From Castle Black, the Night's Watch rides forth in a great ranging and ventures beyond the Wall to confront Mance Rayder and brave the fury of the wild. If they fail to defend the realms of men, the consequences could reach far beyond the icy heights of the Wall.

A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – For Family Honor is an upcoming Chapter Pack in the "War of Five Kings" cycle that continues to follow the storyline of A Clash of Kings. Throughout this Chapter Pack, you'll find plenty of new cards that support the major themes of the cycle.
